dateline.placeName: OFFICE OF ALL THE YEAR ROUND,

body.p: Many thanks for your capital Christmas Book,Holidays with Hobgoblins; and Talk of Strange Things, illustrated by George Cruikshank; dated 1861, printed 1860 which I have read by the fireside with the greatest pleasure. As an amiable exchange of Prisoners, I send you my Uncommercial Traveller.The first series of 17 articles gathered from All the Year Round, published Jan 61; copies were ready by 15 Dec 60 (To Chapman, 5 Dec 60; Pilgrim Letters 9, p. 347 & n). The copy, in which this letter is inserted, is inscribed “With kind regards from CHARLES DICKENS | Christmas 1860” (Pilgrim Letters 9, p. 352n). With kind regard to Mrs. Costello.Mary Frances, widow of J. D.Tweedy; married Costello, 23 Sep 43.
